name: Mysore Masala Dosa
history: Mysore Masala Dosa is a variation of the classic Dosa, originating from the city of Mysore in Karnataka, India. It's renowned for its spicy red chutney layered inside the dosa.
description: Mysore Masala Dosa is a crispy, rice and lentil crepe filled with a spicy red chutney and a savory potato filling. It's a staple in South Indian cuisine, known for its unique flavor and texture.

equipment.name: pan
equipment.description: For making the potato filling and red chutney.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dosa Batter
instructions.description: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds for 4-6 hours. Grind to a smooth batter, adding water as needed. Allow to ferment overnight.

instructions.title: Make the Red Chutney
instructions.description: Grind dried red chilies, tamarind pulp, garlic, and salt into a smooth paste. Set aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Potato Filling
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Add onions and saut√©. Mix in boiled potatoes, turmeric, and salt. Garnish with coriander leaves.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick pan. Pour a ladle of batter and spread thinly. Apply red chutney over it. Place some potato filling in the center and fold the dosa.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Mysore Masala Dosa hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

tips: The consistency of the dosa batter is crucial for a crispy dosa.
The red chutney should be spicy and spread thinly.
variations: Plain Mysore Dosa: Skip the potato filling for a simpler version.
Cheese Mysore Dosa: Add grated cheese to the filling for a cheesy twist.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container and the potato filling separately.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat the potato filling in a microwave or on the stove. Cook fresh dosas for the best taste.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional banana leaf for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped coriander on the potato filling.
